data.name: Line Numbers
data.description:
In this kata the objective is to give line numbers to every nth line. 
the function 
````
numLine(str, n)
````
takes a str and returns another str with every nth line numbered. Each line number should be right aligned, and blank lines should not be numbered and do not count for line numbering purposes. Each line ends with "\n". 

The right alignment of the line number should start 3 spaces beyond the longest line length. 

For example: 
````
var ex = "\
one line\n\
\n\
two line\n\
three line\n\
...
ten line"

numLin(ex, 1)
````
should return 
````
"\
one line     1\n\
\n\
two line     2\n\
three line   3\n\
...
ten line     10"
````
or as a single line string:
````
"one line     1\n\ntwo line     2\nthree line   3\nten line     10"
````
Oh yeah I almost forgot, since n = 1 should return every line number, and n =2 should return all the even lines, and n = 3 will do every third line, make sure to include a way to print just the odd line numbers (ie. 1,3,5,7 etc). The value passed to n in this case is 1.5.

Best of luck friends!
